description: A molecule is a row of atoms joined together by bonds; each atom has a valence (e.g. 1 - 3 = 2 is a molecule with 3 atoms); a(n) = number of molecules with n atoms and different valencies from 1 to n.
comments: Reference needed! [ _N. J. A. Sloane_ ]a(n)=0 whenever A000217(n) is odd, because sum of atoms must be twice the sum of the bonds and both are integers. Full explanation on Munafo web page. [From _Robert Munafo_, Jun 22 2009]
links: Robert Munafo, A Restricted Class of Permutations [From _Robert Munafo_, Jun 22 2009]
example: For n=4 the a(4)=2 solutions are 1-2-4*3 and 1-3=4=2 (where * is a triple bond) [From _Robert Munafo_, Jun 22 2009]
author: Mario Velucchi (mathchess(AT)velucchi.it)
